intro: Sclarea rhodantha, commonly known as the red-flowered angelica, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, umbrella-shaped inflorescences that produce showy pink to red flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a strong, spicy odor when crushed. Sclarea rhodantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
